params._maxHolderCount: is the new maximum amount of token holders
Maximum no. of holders this module allows the SecurityToken to have

getTokensByPartition(bytes32,address,uin.details: returning the balance of token holder against the UNLOCKED partition.  This condition is valid only when the base contract doesn't implement the `getTokensByPartition()` function.

reclaimERC20(address).details: We duplicate here due to the overriden owner & onlyOwner

params._tokenContract: The address of the token contract

reclaimETH().details: We duplicate here due to the overriden owner & onlyOwner

verifyTransfer(address,address,uint256,b.details: module.verifyTransfer is called by SecToken.canTransfer and does not receive the updated holderCount therefore     verifyTransfer has to manually account for pot. tokenholder changes (by mimicking TokenLib.adjustInvestorCount).     module.executeTransfer is called by SecToken.transfer|issue|others and receives an updated holderCount      as sectoken calls TokenLib.adjustInvestorCount before executeTransfer.

devdoc.title: Transfer Manager for limiting maximum number of token holders

changeHolderCount(uint256).notice: Sets the cap for the amount of token holders there can be

configure(uint256).notice: Used to initialize the variables of the contract

executeTransfer(address,address,uint256,.notice: Used to verify the transfer transaction and prevent a transfer if it passes the allowed amount of token holders

getDataStore().notice: used to return the data store address of securityToken

getInitFunction().notice: This function returns the signature of configure function

getPermissions().notice: Returns the permissions flag that are associated with CountTransferManager

getTokensByPartition(bytes32,address,uin.notice: return the amount of tokens for a given user as per the partition

verifyTransfer(address,address,uint256,b.notice: Used to verify the transfer transaction and prevent a transfer if it passes the allowed amount of token holders
